data.name: Collatz problem
data.description:
Consider the sequence ğ´ starting with the number ğ‘.</br>

Each subsequent word of this sequence ğ´<sub>k</sub> + 1 is based on the previous word ğ´<sub>k</sub>.</br>

More precisely, if ğ´<sub>k</sub> is odd then ğ´<sub>k</sub> + 1 = 3 Â· ğ´<sub>k</sub> + 1, and if ğ´<sub>k</sub> is even then ğ´<sub>k</sub>+ 1 = ğ´<sub>k</sub> / 2.</br>

We assume that the string ends with the first occurrence of the number 1.</br>

For example, for ğ‘ = 46, the sequence consists of 17 elements and looks as follows: 
```c# 
{ 46, 23, 70, 35, 106, 53, 160, 80, 40, 20, 10, 5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1 }
```
Given the number ğ‘€ specifying the expected number of elements in the string ğ´, then
find a reasonably small initial value of the string ğ‘, for which the length of the created string ğ´ is exactly ğ‘€.</br>

Max time of completed: 10s </br>

`Input :`
```c#
Natural number M (1 <= M <= 1800) specifying the expected length of the string ğ´.
```
`Output: `
```c#
Number N specifying the starting word of the string ğ´.
```
The value of ğ‘ must be a positive integer and cannot exceed 10<sup>18</sup>

Example:

```c#
  CollatzLength(17) => 46
  CollatzLength(7) => 10
```
